sanchez-rada-etal-2023-sliwc.title: {SLIWC}, Morality, {N}arr{O}nt and Senpy Annotations: four vocabularies to fight radicalization
sanchez-rada-etal-2023-sliwc.author:
S{\'a}nchez-Rada, J. Fernando  and
Araque, Oscar  and
Garc{\'\i}a-Grao, Guillermo  and
Iglesias, Carlos {\'A}.
sanchez-rada-etal-2023-sliwc.paperMotivationText: Large-scale analysis of social media data requires shared vocabularies and linked data
sanchez-rada-etal-2023-sliwc.paperContributionText: 4 vocabularies for data processing and visualization of social media content that capture morality and narratives
sanchez-rada-etal-2023-sliwc.paperResultsText: Use case of semantically annotating resources using a mixture of existing vocabularies and ad-hoc vocabularies for niche or otherwise unexplored domains
sanchez-rada-etal-2023-sliwc.dataYesCommentText: The data provides a standardisation of existing resources only
